info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 6:29PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN HAMILTON AND SOUTHWESTERN BUTLER COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM EDT... At 629 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Ross, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Fairfield, Oxford, Forest Park, Trenton, Springdale, Harrison, North College Hill, Mount Healthy, Ross, Seven Mile, Taylor Creek, Williamsdale, Dry Ridge, Skyline Acres, Blue Jay, Dunlap, White Oak, Colerain Township and Darrtown. This includes I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 1 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
